title: SB 1.19.6 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 06-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: In this session we will be discussing from the 6th verse of the 19th chapter.
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and an introduction to the topic: Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 1, Chapter 19, Verse 6.

segments.key_quote: Consequently everyone who is destined to die must take shelter of this river.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and translates verse 6, highlighting the purifying power of the Ganges and the necessity of taking shelter of it in preparation for death.

segments.key_quote: Therefore this verse is telling everyone who is destined to die must take shelter of this river.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the glorification of the Ganges and Yamuna rivers, emphasizing their purifying qualities and suitability as a shelter for those facing death.

segments.key_quote: Maharaj Pariksit just after receiving the news of his death within seven days at once retired from family life.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Parikshit Maharaj's immediate renunciation upon learning of his impending death and contrasts this with the traditional varnashrama system and its stages of life.

segments.key_quote: Srila Jiva Goswami statement appears to be more accurate because of the geographical situation.
segments.summary: The speaker explains why Srila Jiva Goswami suggests Parikshit Maharaj took shelter on the bank of the Yamuna rather than the Ganges, based on geographical considerations.

segments.key_quote: Lord Krishna sanctified the river Yamuna from the beginning of his transcendental pastimes in this world
segments.summary: The speaker describes how Lord Krishna sanctified the Yamuna River from the beginning of his pastimes, specifically when Vasudeva carried baby Krishna across the river.

segments.key_quote: The Lord fell down into the river Yamuna Krishna fell down and by the dust of his lotus feet the river at once became sanctified
segments.summary: The speaker continues the story of Krishna's pastimes in the Yamuna, explaining how the river became sanctified by the dust of his lotus feet and the presence of Tulasi leaves.

segments.key_quote: There is no difference between the water of Ganges and the Yamuna because both these waters are washing the lotus feet of the same Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the origin of the Ganges and emphasizes the oneness of Ganga and Yamuna, as well as the ultimate oneness of Vishnu, Rama, and Krishna, before concluding the lecture.
